content: Software development — or at least language development — also has some structural similarities to movie making. One starts from a script — an overall specification of what one wants the finished product to be like. Then one actually tries to build it. Then, inevitably, at the end when one looks at what one has, one realizes one has to change the specification. In movies like Arrival, that’s post-production. In software, it’s more an iteration of the development process.
